intro: Tragacantha brachytropis, commonly known as the short-stemmed tragacanth, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by pods containing seeds. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments due to its deep root system. Tragacantha brachytropis is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
